item.title: Report E-2025020057
item.description:
Report E-2025020057

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: HUNTSVILLE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 31, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1866 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the spent product. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew completed a tote transfer and staged the damaged tote for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025020166
item.description:
Report X-2025020166

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON January 17th during the AM sort a package was discovered to be leaking. The package was marked as UN2794 Batteries, Wet, Filled with Acid, 8. It is unclear what caused the leak as the outer package appered to be undamaged. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the consignee was contacted to retrieve the package.

item.title: Report E-2025010431
item.description:
Report E-2025010431

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1510ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal NBM in Bessemer, AL. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of WELD-ON 719 CLEAR released from (1) 5-gallon metal bucket due to improper loading (load shifted during transit and buckets fell over). 3-4 buckets were dented but only one bad enough to leak and it is the only one being held back. The release impacted trailer# 3113513. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
